pull.title: Fix FreeBSD build by including utilstrencodings.h
pull.body:
`random.cpp` needs to explicitly include `utilstrencodings.h` to get `ARRAYLEN`. This fixes the FreeBSD build.

This was broken in 84f41946b9026e8bf7bc44ed848dfb945394b693 (#13236).

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

rename.from: Fix FreeBSD build by including utilstrencodigs.h
rename.to: Fix FreeBSD build by including utilstrencodings.h

events.body:
utACK e8fe9fc361d1acb9183d7bcd9a7aa0ca53c38af5

Though, I think the include should be moved into the `#ifdef HAVE_SYSCTL_ARND`, so that this doesn't happen again in the future.

To work around the whole `utilstrencodings` header, you could include and switch to the cpp11 `std::array`.

Feel free to ignore my style nits.

> To work around the whole utilstrencodings header, you could include and switch to the cpp11 std::array.

I don't want to 'work around' utilstrencodings, I simply want this to build on FreeBSD again :(

> nit: This is only needed when within the body of the #elif defined(HAVE_SYSCTL_ARND) guard, so you might as well guard the include.
> There's an existing block at line 36.

Good idea, will move it into that (edit: done, and it still works).

events.message:
Fix FreeBSD build by including utilstrencodings.h

`random.cpp` needs to explicitly include `utilstrencodings.h` to get
`ARRAYLEN`. This fixes the FreeBSD build.

This was broken in 84f41946b9026e8bf7bc44ed848dfb945394b693.

issue.title: commits from bitcoin/master
issue.body:
RPC: Introduce getblockstats to plot things
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10757

Cache witness hash in CTransaction
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13011

net: Serve blocks directly from disk when possible
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13151

doc: Bump to Ubuntu Bionic 18.04 in build-windows.md
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13246

Use shared pointer to retain wallet instance
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13063

Fix FreeBSD build by including utilstrencodings.h
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13314

test: Don't include torcontrol.cpp into the test file
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13291

gui: fix visual "overflow" of amount input.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13284

qa: Fix wallet_listreceivedby race
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13304

issue.title: gui: Add leading 0 to QT_VERSION check for QFontDatabase
issue.body:
Also removes the QT_VERSION check around the QFontDatabase #include. 
QFontDatabase has existed since at least Qt 4.2.

This can go in after #13458.

issue.title: ci: Build and run tests once on freebsd
[port] Update BU random number generator
issue.body:
This PR update BU code with the latest Core's when it comes to random number generator especially for what we use in C++ unit tests,but also in other part of the code base.

This the list of Core PR included in this port:

- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9821
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9792
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7891
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10372
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10321
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9480
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9349
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10377
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10837
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10820
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10855
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13314
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12724
- bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14624

An alternative to this approach will be to take the zcash path suggested by @dagurval and that has been partially ported over XT in this wip PR

issue.title: [Refactor] Update RNG code from upstream
issue.body:
This is a collection of upstream PRs that have been backported to bring our RNG (`src/random`) code more up-to-date. The following upstream PRs have been included here:

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12742
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14624 
  - some of this had already been merged previously
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14955
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15250
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15224
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15324
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15296
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15512
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16878
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17151
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17191
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13236
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13314
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17169
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17270
  -  omitted last commit as our testing framework doesn't support it currently
  - omitted https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17270/commits/64e1e022cedf6776c5dffd488ca2e766adca5dc3, to be pulled in after our time utility is updated in a separate PR
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17573
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17507
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17670
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17527
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14127
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21486

comments.body: nit: This is only needed when within the body of the `#elif defined(HAVE_SYSCTL_ARND)` guard, so you might as well guard the include.
There's an existing block at line 36.
